alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 06 at 2:55PM MDT until May 08 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...LONG DURATION RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS FROM 11 AM SATURDAY TO 10 PM MDT SUNDAY EVENING DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE AVERAGE WARMTH AND A VERY UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT MOST AREAS FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT SATURDAY AND AGAIN 10 AM TO 10 PM MDT SUNDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, NEAR RECORD WARMTH AND A VERY UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IS IN EFFECT AREA WIDE FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE AVERAGE WARMTH AND A VERY UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .A dangerous and likely historic stretch of critical fire weather is on tap beginning Saturday and lasting each day at least to the middle of next week. Widespread strong west-southwest winds, above normal warmth, six to fifteen hours of single-digit humidities, and an unstable atmosphere will exist tomorrow. Wind speeds look to persist and even increase in strength Saturday night through Sunday morning through the Northeast Highlands warranting a continuation of that Red Flag Warning through the night while other areas see a break in winds that night. Winds turn southwest areawide during the mid to late mornings of Sunday and Monday, with more above normal warmth, and unstable conditions by the afternoon producing more widespread critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT SATURDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM MDT SUNDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 10 AM to 10 PM MDT Sunday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Monday morning through Monday evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and Highlands, West Central Highlands, North Central and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains, Middle Rio Grande Valley, Northeast and East Central Plains from 11 AM MDT Saturday through 10 PM MDT Saturday evening. Critical conditions will redevelop again Sunday morning through Sunday evening, and again Monday morning through Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 50 mph on Saturday. Southwest winds of 25 to 40 mph with occasional gusts of 45 to 55 mph on Sunday and Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 4 to 15 percent each day. About 8 to 15 hours of single digit humidities along and east of I-25 and along and south of I-40 Saturday, 5 to 15 hours on Sunday, and 4 to 12 hours Monday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and will be hard to control. Long range spotting and dangerous fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
